name: dismally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes you feel very sad and without hope, or that shows someone is sad and without hope: Day and night the sirens screamed dismally. "I'll never get over this," he said dismally.
informal in a way that is very bad: Their attempts failed dismally. I was excited to read this novel, but I was dismally disappointed. See
dismal
More examplesFewer examplesMy thoughts turned dismally to the future.The project failed dismally, embarrassingly, totally.They ran the country dismally.Friends and relatives of the murdered women gazed dismally at the defendant in court.The record is full of dismally bland ballads.
